ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: when no assignment due, 1. when an assignment due, 5-10.
2 - most weeks only needed to do the readings
About 3 hours
4-8 hours
Spent perhaps 5 hours per week - weeks where assignments were due (maybe 10)
On average, 3 hours.
1 if no assignment due 4-6 if there was an assignment due

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: an interesting course in terms of material and perspective, but nothing too innovative in the format or lectures. very textbook in how to run a class, except the assignments are interesting to do. if it would be possible to do away with the in-class final, then i would recommend that.
The class was very good. The topics were very relevant to my course of study and my interest in policy.
excellent introduction to women and children issues and equips you with the tools you need to address these issues through health policy and research
Very good course, for both students in Public Health and not. Materials were accessible and interesting; lectures were clear and there was room for class participation. Assignments were useful.

Great overview course PPT slides have ALOT of information - maybe do away with the final exam or provide a study guide to help us distill the important info needed for the final. Did not get much into inequities found in MCH and would have liked to see more of that

I learned so much about the various factors that affect the health of women and children in the US. The main lectures were great and the guest lectures were interesting. The policy briefs were helpful and the testimony was extremely valuable.
This course was great! I learned so much and loved how pre-professional the focus was.

I loved this course. The material was well presented and the professor very knowledgeable. I enjoyed the class discussions and the opportunity to go further with the assignments. However, sometimes class could seem to be moving slow and it would have been useful to have a little more instruction about the assignments.
Very good introduction to policy issues surrounding women and children in the US.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  has some amazing experiences and incorporates them very well into her lecture.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  She is excellent!
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Knowledgeable, experienced, and kind.

Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Mary Alice was excellent, she really cares about her students, takes the time to get to know us and leverages our diverse backgrounds to add to the class. She engages us all in discussion which adds real life experiences to the class.

Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  I appreciate Dr. Lee's lecturing style, her PowerPoint presentations and her inclusion of anecdotes and current events. She gave room for students to participate and ask questions. She was interested in our work and supportive.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Very sweet and open to suggestions! Always accessible! - would like to see some more examples of what is done on the local level for women and children.

Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Professor Lee cares deeply about her students and is always generous with her time and help. Her lectures are clear and she supplements them with enlightening anecdotes that highlight certain policies' strengths and weaknesses. Overall, I had a wonderful semester! Thank you, Professor Lee!
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Professor Lee was wonderful. She really cared about each and every one of us individually.

Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Mary Alice is fantastic. She is so knowledgeable about this topic and so excited to be working with students. She's always available to talk with students, both inside and outside the classroom.
Instructor: Mary Alice Lee  Excellent and passionate about maternal and child health.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: lecture based with 3 assignments (mostly due in the second half of the course) and an in class final. a good class to give you exposure to an important public health matter. i would recommend it to any student, but especially policy because it is a good chunk of knowledge to get exposed to and the assignments would help develop your skill set with policy briefs.
Yep. I will recommend to students who are interested in maternal and child health.
I would recommend this course to another student who was interested in maternal and child health policy.
Great class, light on workload and the assignments are interesting and useful.

I recommend this course, even if you are not a student in the school of Public Health. It provided a very thorough overview of healthcare in the US (not only for women/children, but more broadly as well). The workload was manageable and there wasn't "busy work" -- I felt readings and assignments were all pertinent to the course, and a good supplement to the lecture content.
Great overview for someone interested in Maternal and Child Health in the US. Not too much work, but meaningful assignments.

This class is amazing! I learned so much about various factors that affect the health of women and children in the US. The guest lecturers were great and the assignments were interesting. The testimony was a valuable experience and I am very fortunate to have had the opportunity to present one to the class. Professor Lee has much experience in this field and offers great anecdotes concerning the realities of certain policies. She is a warm and caring instructor who is passionate about the course and sincerely cares about her students. I would highly recommend this class.
This was a fantastic course if you're interested in learning about healthcare in the US with a special focus on women and children.
I would highly recommend this course. It is well taught and very interesting.
